title: Migrating to a new Windows laptop has affected IMAP
content:
G'day from 'Straya!

I have migrated Thunderbird from one Windows laptop to another, copying the profile and all included files. This mostly worked but has created a couple of issues I am trying to troubleshoot and could really use some help.

First thing probably worth noting is that I had an earlier version of Thunderbird on the old laptop than the new one downloaded to the new laptop. I don't that if that is the problem.

I have two email accounts which are both using IMAP. When I delete an email in Thunderbird, it keeps coming back and I now have multiple copies of that email. My storage is filling up ðŸ˜’ Is there a setting I am missing?

Additionally, the migration does not seem to have brought over my contacts. Did I miss something?

Any help and advice will be greatly appreciated.
creator: martianfj+firefox

title: Updated to Nebula and now my Gmail account doesn't work
content: Thunderbird just updated to this new Nebula version and now my Gmail account isn't working. I have other accounts setup and they seem to still work (Outlook based) It sits there trying to sync my calendar or I get Checking mail server capabilities. It also doesn't shutdown when I exit Thunderbird. What is going on?
creator: paul.sage65

title: Sending Emails to an address book list
content: I have prepared a new list in my address book of 36 addresses. I called it Signatures 2024. I tried to send the emails and it won't send and I have received a note "Invalid Recipient Address. Signatures 2024 is not a valid email address because it is not of the form user@host. You must correct it before sending." I have done similar many times in the past with success so do not know what to do. It is urgent that I get this email out. Regards Bevan Lawrence
creator: lhlaw

title: Message list backgrounds colours to match accounts
content:
Is it possible to give each email account a color and have the message list backgrounds match the account colors? It would make it much easier to know which account has received the email when viewing the Unified Folders Inbox. I think this used to be possible with an extension called 'account colors' but it no longer works in 128.

I have noticed that I can change the account icon colors (r.click account > Properties) but it doesn't translate to the message list.

Thanks for your help.
creator: oliwally1

title: missing address books
content: Hi, I've recently managed to re-install version 102.15.1 on my laptops and desktop as I hated 115 with a passion. I'd also had microsoft making my life hell with their OAUTH and cookies shenanigans. I could only access my outlook/hotmail accounts by using outlook in a browser which I really hate and is why I started using Thunderbird years ago. Anyhoo, since I managed to install 102.15.1 again and sort out microsofts problem I've found that my address books have disappeared. I've seen answers to other peoples problems mentioning profiles etc. but that just baffles me. I just want my address books back, ( both collected and personal ) as it makes it so much easier when addressing emails to just type the first couple of letters and then choose from the results rather than having to ytype the complete address. So if any can help I'll really appreciate it, Thanks. Alf J alf.j.slawson@outlook.com
creator: Alf.J

title: CANNOT DOWN LOAD EMAILS USING THUNDERBIRDS
content: I have successfully used Thunderbirds for 10 years on my 2013 Mac BookPro. During the last 6 months I've had a number of instances when Thunderbirds could not connect with the server. (See attached image). I have found that hitting the Cancel key and letting the system sort itself out was the best option as I always managed to download my emails. As of the 16 Sept 2024 this has method has not been successful and I have had to resort to Mail on my iPad. This is not very satisfactory as all history and contacts are with Thunderbirds. I need a solution to login to my Thunderbirds account. I've not changed any settings or passwords. I'm running Norton 360 security on all computers in this household and have for 15 years. HELP!!!!!
creator: dinosaur.t-rex

title: nebula msf corruption
content:
Hi,

I have Thunderbird nebula 128.2.2esr (64-bit). The msf files seem to corrupt many times each day. This results in 'repairing' folders or when this fails - and it is pretty frequent - restarting Thunderbird.

I have tried completely deleting Thunderbird and all data files - reinstalling - and the same result.

Please help. Shalom Norman
creator: abpt2251

title: Emails lost after repairing corrupt inbox
content:
Iâ€™ve been using Thunderbird for quite a few years now but recently out of the blue I noticed that all emails starting from 2000 to a few weeks ago show up blank when opened. After googling this issue I found someone who suggested I repair the inbox in Thunderbird (right click and repair), which I did. However now all those mails that first showed up blank are completely missing from my inbox. I know theyâ€™re still there because when I search for them Thunderbird can find them and even shows the first few sentences of the email. But when I attempt to open them theyâ€™re empty again.

It seems to be an indexing issue, which Iâ€™ve tried to resolve by removing the indexing file (to a different location just in case). Then starting up Thunderbird again to rebuild the file, sadly this did not resolve the issue.

Normally I would just re-sync these emails from online, however due to an issue with my mail provider these are no longer available there.

I know the emails are still there stored locally, but I canâ€™t access them anymore.

Can anyone help?

My mail account uses POP
creator: arkotaxidiaris

title: inbox pane
content: in the email inbox pane, the line or mail in the inbox used to be every space, now they are every other space. How do I fix that?
creator: tncongdon

title: Remove e-mail from Corespondents column
content:
Win 365 desktop, Thunderbird 128.2.2esr (64-bit) -- all updates current.

With the last update every e-mail displays both the name and e-mail of the sender in the Corespondents column of the inbox and other folders. While I understand the security value of this I find it much more difficult to read. They become very long and cluttered. Is there any setting I can change to make the e-mail part not display?

Even better would be a setting or update where the sender name and e-mail are separate columns.
creator: gatekat

title: PERDITA MAIL DI UN SOLO ACCOUNT
content: La settimana scorsa, al mio rientro dalle ferie e prima riaccensione del pc, ho rilevato di avere perso tutte le mail relative alla mia PEC, purtroppo unica configurata POP e non IMAP. Ho provato ad utilizzare il mio ultimo backup senza risolvere. Inutile dire che non ho effettuato di mia azione diretta alcuna cancellazione. Ho controllato nel sito internet della PEC, ma purtroppo, trattandosi di configurazione POP, sono sparite anche li. Thunderbird esegue qualche forma di backup automatico/archiviazione che mi permetta il recupero delle mail. Accetto ogni Vs/ cortese suggerimento. Grazie Luciano SACCA'
creator: studiolucianosacca

title: Thunderbird Calendar Entries Displayed Incorrectly on 27/10/2024
content:
In Thunderbird calendar, on 27th Oct 2024, entries added are displayed one hour ahead of where they should be. If the entry is edited, the times are correct, and they show correctly in another calendar app (Calendar on my iPhone). The issue does not occur for events on the day before or the day after, and is the same for a newly added event as for an existing one.

See screen shots. You can see my test event displayed at 11:00 - 12:00 but on editing it is actually 10:00 - 11:00 - the latter is correct.

27th Oct is the day that DST ends in the UK (at 0200) in 2024, but the events are several hours after that.

Nick.
creator: nick225

i have imported my emails from outlook 2007 to TB 31.8.0 as that is what was suggested.

Am i trying for too much in TB or is it possible?

title: Issue with Uploading Emails to Gmail via Thunderbird (IMAP OAuth2 Authentication)
content:
What is the business impact you are facing?

I am unable to complete the transfer of over 20,000 emails from a Gmail account to a new G Suite account using Thunderbird. This issue is causing significant delays in the migration process, impacting the continuity of communication and data management within the business.

Issue description

I am using Thunderbird to upload emails that were previously downloaded via Google Takeout from a Gmail account to a new G Suite account. The connection to the Gmail IMAP server seems to be correct, as Thunderbird authenticates successfully using OAuth2. However, when attempting to upload the emails, the process stalls. Some emails are uploaded, but many are not, and the upload process stops without providing a clear error message. I need assistance in identifying why Thunderbird is not handling the bulk upload of emails properly and finding a solution to this issue.

Connection details with Google:

â€¢ Server name: imap.gmail.com â€¢ Port: 993 â€¢ Username: ventas@zeusequipos.com â€¢ Authentication method: OAuth2

The connection and authentication work correctly, but the emails do not upload completely.

Is it intermittent or consistent?

The issue is consistent. It occurs every time I attempt to upload emails in bulk.

Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Download emails from a Gmail account using Google Takeout. 2. Attempt to upload the emails to a new G Suite account using Thunderbird. 3. Despite successful authentication and connection with Gmailâ€™s IMAP server, the upload process stalls, and many emails are not uploaded.

Browser

Not applicable (issue occurs in Thunderbird).

Operating system

Windows 10.

Does clearing cookies, cache, and restarting the browser help?

Not applicable (issue occurs in Thunderbird).

Does this issue persist in Thunderbirdâ€™s safe mode?

Yes, the issue persists.

Does this issue persist across different computers?

Yes, I have tried on another machine, and the issue remains.

Does this issue persist across different networks?

Yes, the issue persists on a different network.
creator: jmurilloloaiza

title: Urgent Issues with Thunderbird Email Service
content:
Hello,

I have been using Thunderbird for some time since it's compatible with my company's email system. However, I have been experiencing multiple issues with this platform. Not only is it difficult to use and impossible to automate emails, but I also keep losing emails, and it doesn't filter spam correctly. As a result, I receive phishing emails that I can't report, and they keep coming.

Since this morning, I've been encountering even more unusual problems. When I try to open an email with an attachment, an old email from about a year ago opens instead, containing a PNG attachment that has nothing to do with the current email. In other words, when I open a new email with an attachment, I can't see its content; I just see this old, unrelated email. This issue only occurs with new emails that have attachments; older emails and emails without attachments are not affected.

The IT team of my company has tried to assist me but hasn't been able to find a solution. Additionally, I've been attempting to switch to another email platform like Outlook or any other compatible tool, but I can't seem to access my account. I've tried so many times that I'm now getting an error message saying I've reached the maximum number of attempts and have failed the password check. I have also tried uninstalling Thunderbird from my computer to reinstall it, but for some reason, Thunderbird won't uninstall either.

I have videos documenting these issues if needed. This is a very urgent matter, as these emails are high-priority, and I need to respond to them but can't because I can't view their content.

I kindly request your immediate assistance to resolve this issue.

Thank you.
creator: cecilia6

title: indirizzo mittente
content: Buonasera a tutti; ho configurato la pec servicematica su thunderbird. Da qualche giorno, dopo che ho notato un aggiornamento e modifica della pagina di thunderbird, gli indirizzi mail dei mittenti non sono quelli reali, ma sempre e solo due (svolgo la professione di avvocato e tutte le pec provenienti dal Tribunale, risultano, sia nella schermata iniziale sotto mittenti e corrispondenti, ma anche nel messaggio stesso nella voce "per conto di", con indirizzo non del tribunale ma di altro soggetto). Tutte le pec degli ultimi 10 anni, presentano questo problema nella voce "mittente". Non riesco a trovare il modo di risolvere il problema, abbastanza grave dato che rischio di dover produrre in giudizio pec con mittente errato. Se accedo direttamente dall'account servicematica o dal cellulare, il problema non si pone. Grazie a tutti

title: new Thunderbird version Approval required
content:
Hi Thunderbird Support Team,

I recently installed the latest version of Thunderbird in a Hyper-V virtual machine and encountered the following message: " Approval required Mozilla Thunderbird This app requires your admin's approval to: Read and write access to mailboxes via IMAP. Read and write access to mailboxes via POP.

Allows the app to have the same access to mailboxes as the signed-in user via POP protocol.

This is a permission requested to access your data in xx Send emails from mailboxes using SMTP AUTH. Maintain access to data you have given it access to View users' basic profile"

This was functioning with the previous version of Thunderbird, but now my IT team requires additional information about what the app is trying to do with our Office 365 environment. The approval process is crucial because some apps may introduce security risks or seek extensive access to our Office 365 resources.

Could you please provide more detailed information on the permissions requested and the specific changes in this version compared to previous versions? This will help in getting the necessary approval from our IT team.

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards, Jenny
creator: jenny.chen

title: Thunderbird scalling changes dynamically in between internal monitor and external monitors
content:
I solved this problem already by finding this thread previously :

https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1399586

If your thunderbird window shrinks when being displayed on your internal laptop monitor but expands when displayed on an external monitor (or vice versa) it is because if the value for

layout.css.devPixelsPerPx (Edit -> Settings -> General -> (all the way down) Config Editor -> (search for) layout.css.devPixelsPerPx)

is set to a positive value. It seems like the value has a reverse effect in between internal and external monitors (shrink one and expands one).

To fix this issue, set the value for layout.css.devPixelsPerPx to -1

I am posting this question to display this solution to the public if anyone else experiences a similar issue.

title: Just updated to Thunderbird version 128.2.1esr (64-bit) and seem to have lost a couple of functions.
content:
Hi Folks,

As I said above, I just updated to Thunderbird version 128.2.1esr (64-bit) and seem to have lost a couple of functions, in particular the ability to make a new Tab, and the use of an extremely handy Add-on, Shrunked Image Resizer. I have Mac OS 12.7.6 and I noticed in the release notes for 128.2.1esr (64-bit) that this latest version's System Requirements are MacOS 10.15 or later. Does that mean that I should not have downloaded the latest version, and if so, how can I revert to an earlier version of TB that will allow me to use Tabs and Shrunked Image Resizer? I thought that Thunderbird was capable of recognizing which version of Mac OS I have and thus would not suggest I update to the latest version of TB if it won't work as it did with an earlier version of TB. I would be very grateful if you could suggest a solution to my problem.

Thanks, Chris O'Brien

title: Keeps trying to compact folders, created subfolders within folders, duplicating emails (gmail)
content:
A month or so ago a systems update was sent to my software for the Mozilla Thunderbird. It wasn't anything we performed on our end. But ever since then it keeps trying to compact folders, created subfolders within folders, duplicating emails many times over within a folder, some of the duplicate emails have no content, some have the subject line of one email but the content of a different email.

It keeps freezing up and has to be rebooted. Or I go to a folder that should lots of emails and nothing displays. It is affecting my job.

Right now I have NO access to any of my emails for the last five years. I get the emails from my Gmail account, which I have forwarded to my Thunderbird software because I like the ability to keep everything organized within various folders then subfolder which I cannot do with the basic Gmail software. I only archive my Gmail account for the last six months so I have no backfile there. I have used Thunderbird software for several years and have relied on its organization. But if this doesn't get fixed I might as well retire since I cannot do my job. Our library's IT person can't work on it since it isn't software that the University license. I realize that no one will probably be able to help but I am asking for any guidance I can get.

title: Gmail: Moving and archiving won't delete from the server
content:
Basically, I'm trying to use Thunderbird to clear some space on my Gmail account. I'm using IMAP. However that just won't work (most of the time). If I archive emails to a local archive or move it to a local folder, a) nothing happens, b) the files are actually moved (and appear in the archive folders)... but the mails remain on the server when checking through Gmail itself. Also, the mails reappear after 10-20 minutes. c) mails are actually moved and they are removed from the server. Mostly it's a or b.

I have tried all deletion options... delete directly (doesn't appear to work), mark as deleted (won't free up space) or move to Trash. Depending on the folder it used to work for a short while, with the mails appearing in the trash folder, ready for deletion. But that stopped working again.

This is all super frustrating and I have no idea if this is a bug or expected behaviour.
